thread.title: Hill limited and three key players out of Bengals practice
thread.title_full: Hill limited and three key players out of Bengals practice

title: Hill limited and three key players out of Bengals practice
text:
Hill limited and three key players out of Bengals practice 
Updated: Wed, Oct 07 2015, 06:09 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- While Bengals starting safety George Iloka practiced on Wednesday after missing Sunday's game against the Kansas City Chiefs, three other players did not practice and starting running back Jeremy Hill was among four players who were limited participants. 
The Bengals began on-field preparations on Wednesday for this Sunday's 1 p.m. against Seattle. 
The three starters who didn't practice on Wednesday were: cornerback Adam Jones; offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth and defensive lineman Wallace Gilberry. 
Jones played only a couple of plays in the second half of Sunday's win over Kansas City after suffering a groin injury. He took part in warming up on Wednesday and then moved to the rehab field for the remaining portion of the 30 minutes practice was open to the media. 
Jones didn't practice last Wednesday due to an elbow injury he had suffered in the Baltimore game and was listed as questionable for the Kansas City game because of that injury, but started. 
Whitworth was listed as missing Wednesday due to what was termed non-injury related, which means he got a veteran's day off as he has each week so far this season and did almost every week last season. 
Gilberry missed due to a calf injury. He did some work on the rehab field during the time practice was open to the media. 
Hill, who scored three touchdowns in Sunday's win over Kansas City, was a limited participant due to a knee injury. 
Cornerback Leon Hall (non-injury related) and safety Reggie Nelson (hamstring) were also limited participants. 
Iloka missed Sunday's game against Kansas City due to an ankle injury and was also a limited participant. He didn't practice at all last week and said that was tougher on him than missing the game. 
"It was hard on Wednesday and Thursday coming up here knowing I'm missing my first game ever," said Iloka. "As the week goes by you have confidence in guys that they're going to go out there and do their thing. The fact that we came out with the win made it even easier for me." 
Jeremy Hill photo: Tony Tribble
